description.value:
These tools are used for stonemasonry, primarily in the construction of buildings, walls, and fortifications. Skilled masons understand the durability, weight, and shaping of stone, making them invaluable for both crafting and breaking through structures.

  • Skill Advantage: A mason has &reference[advantage] on checks involving stone or masonry, including but not limited to some &reference[Engineering], &reference[History], &reference[Nature], and &reference[Survival] checks.

  • Open Container or Door: With 1 minute and an &reference[Engineering] skill check, a mason can attempt to open a locked or sealed container or door that would normally require @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-equipment.Item.LMnHshpVe3ciVIwF]{Thieves' Tools}, using the same DC as lockpicking. This breaks the container or door.

  • Break Wall:
    You attempt to break a wall no thicker than 1 ft.
    1 Minute - 5 ft.

    • You make an [[/check eng]]{Engineering check} to break a wall made of stone or material less durable than stone.

      • On a 10 or higher, you can make a hole big enough for a small creature to squeeze through.

      • On a 15 or higher, you can make a hole big enough for a medium creature to squeeze through.

      • On a 20 or higher, you can make a hole up to 5 ft. by 5 ft.

    • If the wall is thicker than 1 ft., multiply the time it takes by the number of feet in thickness.
